attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tax raised by government to be capped at 35% of the UK GDP. Where government perceive a need for more tax, government should petition the British voters for a specific increase in tax revenue for a specific period, e.g. we the government need an extra 15 Billion UK pounds for a period of 3 years to pay for 30 new hospitals. A political party may also include a larger percentage of GDP at the time of a general election for the period of government. Where a government petitions for a tax increase it should publicise exactly how current taxes are spent by department.
